attributes.action: Petitions for autism suitable accommodation and stop discrimination
attributes.additional_details: The current law is unfair and Council avoiding responsibility by hidding behind technicalities/ red tapes
attributes.background: Challenge the current law of councils discriminatory decision on giving suitable accommodation to children with autism

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about accommodation for autistic people, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could also contact your own council if you would like to complain against a decision made. 

You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We also cannot accept petitions in which the petition creator does not provide a full name.
